chargeHist.descr: Repeated Sexual Assault of Same Child (At Least 3 Violations of 1st or 2nd Degree Sexual Assault)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Mitchell D Komorowski was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 2nd Degree Sexual Assault of Child, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(2).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
--to pay costs of $268, plus the $250 DNA surcharge, plus $86 in subpoena fees

The Court orders Statute  301.45 Sex Offender Registration and Reporting, 

The Court finds that, if Probation is revoked, Mr. Komorwoski is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Earned Release Program.

---no direct or indirect contact with A.L.B. or Jolie-Breitzman-Kirkley; as to the contact prohibition involving A.L.B., the Court allows that if there is a child, an exception to the contact prohibition is that the Agent may authorize contact solely for the purposes of child placement exchanges and for communications on child related issues
-no presence within 1000 feet of A.L.B.'s residence, her school, or any location temporarily occupied by her, except as may be allowed by the Agent as necessary to facilitate any child placement exchanges
--the evaluation completed by Dr. Lakshi Subramanian shall be provided to the Agent within 30 days, and the Agent shall consider her recommendations in determing what further assessment and what treatment are required
--if required by the Agent, Mr. Komorowski is to submit to a Sex Offender Evaluation and he is to comply with any recommended follow up treatment/therapy or counseling as directed by the Agent
--a Compass Evaluation is to be prepared and Mr. Komorowski is to comply with assesement, treatment and therapies recommended by that evaluation
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment, and counseling as required by the Agent
--to comply with the Sex Offender Registry 
--not to engage in any acts or threats of violence
--not to engage in any employment or volunteer activities which would involve Mr. Komorowski being responsible to supervise minor children
--to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program as approved by the Agent
--no direct or indirect contact with minor females under age 18, except for incidental contact related to employment or educational programming, and except for contact with relatives; or as specifically authorized by the Agent 
--to comply with DNA sample provision upon request 

Arresting Agency: JESO

--to reimburse the Jefferson County Sheriff's Office $43 in investigation expenditures related to obtaining the victim's medical records

  If probation, parole or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of the victim(s) and government entities for the balance due.

supervisions.notes:
On Counts #1 - Court sentences to 3 1/2 years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of  1 years & 6 months, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 2 years.  This sentence is to commence forthwith. 

The Court finds that the Defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Earned Credit Program.

The Court gives 260 days credit for time already served on the case in total.

Petition is dened because the Verification of Time Served - form (CR-261) was not completed. It appears defendant has not served 85% of the confinement portion of his sentence -- initial confinement of 18 months =540 days; he was given 260 days credit for time served at the sentencing after revocation hearing on 6/2/16, and has been incarcerated an additional 49(or 50) days since then, which amounts to about 57% of the confinement period. records.addlTxt:
Case called at 3:01pm.  Clerk - CRHI. 
Defendant Mitchell D Komorowski in court with attorney Paul E Bucher.  Defendant Mitchell D Komorowski in custody.  ADA Beck appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Agent Carrie Reuhl also appears for the Department of Corrections. 
Procedural issues addressed by the Court and Counsel including verifying that both parties have all correspondence and that both parties acknowledge handling requirements related to the report filed. 
Arguments presented by Counsel. 
Statements presented by the defendant's parents.
Statement presented by the defendant. 

On Counts #1 - Court sentences to 3 1/2 years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of  1 years & 6 months, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 2 years.  This sentence is to commence forthwith. 

The Court finds that the Defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Earned Credit Program.

The Court orders as conditions of Extended Supervision:
--no direct or indirect contact with A.L.B. 
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment, and counseling as required by the Agent.  Department to be mindful of the high risk/high need evidence based treatment and not insist on unnecessary treatment
--to comply with the Sex Offender Registry 
--not to engage in any acts or threats of violence
--not to engage in any employment or volunteer activities which would involve being responsible to supervise minor children
--to obtain/maintain employment and/or education programs as approved by the Agent
--no direct or indirect contact with minor females under age 18, except for incidental contact related to employment or educational programming, and except for contact with relatives; or as specifically authorized by the Agent 
--repayment of all outstanding financial obligations ordered including to reimburse the Jefferson County Sheriff's Office in investigation expenditures related to obtaining the victim's medical records; costs; DNA surcharge and subpoena fees. 
--contact with HN only if and when that there is written custodian permission provided to the agent. 
--a copy of the psychosexual report shall be provided to the Department by the State.  It can then be used by the Department to determine what assessment and/or treatment are needed. 

On Counts #4:
-- the Court orders 9 months jail concurrent to the sentence ordered in Count #1. 
-- outstanding financial obligations are to be converted to civil judgments. 

On Counts #6:
-- the Court orders 9 months jail concurrent to the sentences ordered in Count #1 and in Count #4.
-- outstanding financial obligations are to be converted to civil judgments. 

The Court gives 260 days credit for time already served on the case in total.

from Judge Weston to Erica Schueler re: preparation of transcript

case called at 8:42am. [MK]
Defendant Mitchell D Komorowski in court with Attorney Jeffrey J De La Rosa.  ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
ADA Beck verifies victim rights compliance; the victim impact statement is submitted. 
ADA Beck submits State's Exhibit #1:  a packet of text messages print-outs.
Sentencing arguments given by counsel.
The Court informs the parties that the sentencing arguments of Attorney De La Rosa have caused the Court to feel compelled to disclose, under Statute 757.19(2)(g), that Judge Weston has a recent experience in which similar on-the-defensive interactions are involved; there is some similarity to the reasonings discussed in part of the Defense arguments.  The Court feels it can be impartial and go forward with the sentencing, however the Court is adjourning briefly to allow the parties time to give consideration to this disclosure.
recess 9:43am; reconvene 10:05am.
Both parties agree that this Court should proceed with the Sentencing; there is no objection to this.


On Counts #1,  the Court withholds sentence, and places Mr. Komorowski on Probation for 6 years.
On Counts #4, and #6 each, the Court withholds sentence, and places Mr. Komorowski on Probation for 2 years concurrent. 
The conditions on all three Probation terms are:
--On Count #6:  to serve 30 days in the Jefferson County Jail, with work-release privileges, to commence on 1/17/15 at 7:00pm.; Mr. Komorowki is required to report for commencement and service of jail term with absolute sobriety and without non-prescribed controlled substances in his system; non-compliance will result in loss of work-release privileges without further process.
--no direct or indirect contact with A.L.B. or Jolie-Breitzman-Kirkley; as to the contact prohibition involving A.L.B., the Court allows that if there is a child, an exception to the contact prohibition is that the Agent may authorize contact solely for the purposes of child placement exchanges and for communications on child related issues
--no presence within 1000 feet of A.L.B.'s residence, her school, or any location temporarily occupied by her, except as may be allowed by the Agent as necessary to facilitate any child placement exchanges
--the evaluation completed by Dr. Lakshi Subramanian shall be provided to the Agent within 30 days, and the Agent shall consider her recommendations in determing what further assessment and what treatment are required
--if required by the Agent, Mr. Komorowski is to submit to a Sex Offender Evaluation and he is to comply with any recommended follow up treatment/therapy or counseling as directed by the Agent
--a Compass Evaluation is to be prepared and Mr. Komorowski is to comply with assesement, treatment and therapies recommended by that evaluation
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment, and counseling as required by the Agent
--to comply with the Sex Offender Registry 
--not to engage in any acts or threats of violence
--not to engage in any employment or volunteer activities which would involve Mr. Komorowski being responsible to supervise minor children
--to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program as approved by the Agent
--no direct or indirect contact with minor females under age 18, except for incidental contact related to employment or educational programming, and except for contact with relatives; or as specifically authorized by the Agent 
--On Count #1: to comply with DNA sample provision upon request 
--to reimburse the Jefferson County Sheriff's Office $43 in investigation expenditures related to obtaining the victim's medical records
--On Count #1: to pay costs of $268, plus the $250 DNA surcharge, plus $86 in subpoena fees
--On Count #4: to pay costs of $243, plus the $200 DNA surcharge
--On Count #6: to pay costs of $243, plus the $200 DNA surcharge

The Court orders Statute 301.45 Sex Offender Registration and Reporting, giving the warnings/penalties for non-compliance.  
Days credit for time already served:  1 day
The Court finds that, if Probation is revoked, Mr. Komorwoski is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Earned Release Program.
Felony firearm warnings/penalties given
Contact Prohibition warnings/penalties given
Employment/Volunteer involving children prohibition warnings/penalties given 
Body Armor prohibition warnings/penalties given 
The Court finds that Mr. Komorowski is not eligible for expungement of these convictions. 
recess 10:32am.
Sentencing hearing on January 12, 2015 at 08:30 am.
With elements and criminal case settlement agreement forms attached.

case called at 2:14pm. [MK]
Defendant Mitchell D Komorowski in court with Attorney Jeffrey J De La Rosa.  ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of " Guilty " entered on Counts #1, #4, and #6; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts the pleas, finds Mr. Komorowski guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads in and dismisses Counts #2, #3, #5, #7 and #8.
Attorney De La Rosa request that sentencing be scheduled in approximately sixty days.  Attorney De La Rosa has a psychological report he will be submitting to the Court, and then he wants Mr. Komorowski to undergo another psychological test, so he has that information to report at the time of the sentencing hearing.
Attorney De La Rosa indicates that the parties agree to recommend Probation, however the Defense will be arguing the length of the Probation term, some of the proposed conditions, and the conditional jail term length.
Mr. Komorowski verifies that the Haumschild Lane, Johnson Creek address is current.
The Court indicates that it will keep this case at the time of Judicial Rotation, unless there would be a delay in the sentencing-- if that occurs, the Court intends to have the case transfer by Judicial Rotation to Branch III.  
recess  2:24pm. 

NEXT:  schedule Sentencing during the second week in January, allow one hour

case called at 1:13pm. 
Defendant Mitchell D Komorowski appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, with Attorney Jeffrey De La Rosa (PD will appoint counsel).  Public Service Prosecutor Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin.  

On agreement of counsel, the Court finds that the videoconferencing system is sight and sound sufficient. 

Mr. Komorowski verifies that the date of birth and address listed on the Criminal Complaint 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited. 
The Court finds probable cause to exist in the Criminal Complaint. 
Preliminary Hearing time limits are waived by both parties.

The Court requires a $750 cash bond, with conditions:
--no contact with A.L.B. (dob 5/21/1998)
--no presence within 1000 feet of A.L.B.'s residence
recess 1:35pm. 


NEXT: (1) Pretrial Conference on 3/5/14 at 3:20pm (2) schedule Preliminary Hearing after the Pretrial date
